overview: This subject will cover both theory and evidence. Topics covered will include raising capital, capital structure choice, dividend policy, mergers and acquisitions, contracting and incentives, game theory and signalling models, default and renegotiation and security design.
ilo: Analyse firms’ investment decisions under idealized settings and explain the importance of these decisions for shareholders and the economy
Analyse the legal and institutional determinants of investment and financing decisions
Analyse effects of moral hazard and adverse selection on firms’ investment and financing decisions
Analyse the effects of contracts on problems of moral hazard and adverse selection
Analyse dynamic models of investment and financing decisions and compare these with traditional static models
generic_skills: Synthesis of data and other information
Evaluation of data and other information
Accessing data and other information from a range of sources
